result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malcolm Myron Miller Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller Jr in court.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is not eligible for SPD services; Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Indigency hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller Jr in court, without counsel.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender's Representation and is requesting an adjournment to hire private counsel. Court advised the defendant to have counsel hired by next court appearance. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson.
Case in court for an indigency hearing.  Defendant intends to hire private counsel and requests additional time to retain counsel.  Court adjourns matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-11-2022

Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Defendant appears without counsel. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.   
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bld.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller in custody. Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
